SEARCH
Package model

Class Gate

java.lang.Object
model.Gate
public class Gate extends Object
Represents an airport gate in the airport management system.

This class encapsulates the information about a physical gate at the airport where aircraft park for passenger boarding and disembarkation operations. Gates are identified by a unique ID number and are essential for flight operations and passenger management.

The airport supports gates numbered from 1 to 20, representing the physical infrastructure limitations. Each gate can be assigned to flights for departure and arrival operations. The class enforces validation to ensure only valid gate numbers are used throughout the system.

Key features include:

  • Unique gate identification (1-20)
  • Input validation for gate numbers
  • Integration with flight management
  • Support for gate assignment operations

Gates are typically assigned to flights through the flight management system and are used by various airport operations including passenger boarding, ground services, and airport displays.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Gate

      public Gate(byte parId) throws InvalidGate
      Constructs a new Gate with the specified ID.

      Creates a gate with the given identifier, ensuring that the ID falls within the valid range of 1 to 20. This constructor is used when creating gate objects from user input or database records.

      Parameters:
      parId - the gate identifier, must be between 1 and 20 inclusive
      Throws:
      InvalidGate - if the gate ID is not within the valid range (1-20)

  • Method Details

    • getId

      public byte getId()
      Gets the unique identifier of this gate.

      Returns the gate number that uniquely identifies this gate within the airport. This ID is used for gate assignment, passenger information displays, and airport operations.

      Returns:
      the gate identifier (1-20)

    • setId

      public void setId(byte id) throws InvalidGate
      Sets the unique identifier for this gate.

      Updates the gate number with a new valid identifier. This method includes validation to ensure the new ID falls within the acceptable range. It is typically used for gate reassignment or correction operations.

      Parameters:
      id - the new gate identifier, must be between 1 and 20 inclusive
      Throws:
      InvalidGate - if the new gate ID is not within the valid range (1-20)
